result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders restitution in the stipulated amount of $354.25 to McDonald's located on Potter Ave., $536.00 to Subway located on S. 60th St, $498.00 to Subway located on S. 27th St.; joint and several with Govanni Martinez (15CF470).

COUNT 2 ONLY: If not previously done, provide DNA sample- pay surcharge.
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs by the end of supervision period- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
The Court ordered that all financial obligations and restitution be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  The defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program ONLY AFTER SERVING 5 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to each other and any other sentence; credit for 200 days on COUNT 2 ONLY.

superMiscConds.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession, Body armor possession, and Voting.  Defendant advised of DNA consequences.

No contact with known drug users or locations where illegal substances are trafficked or consume.
No contact with co-actor Govanni E. Martinez (dob 12-25-85).
No contact with McDonald's, Subway, or Burger King stores within Milwaukee Metro Area-defined by the court as the following counties. Milwaukee, Waukesha, Racine, Ozaukee, and Washington.
Participate in Cognitive behavior therapy program and any other programming deemed appropriate by the department/agent.

AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment.
Absolute sobriety- no illegal drugs unless prescribed by physician.
Cooperate with random urine screens- no positive results.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (26 pages) SENTENCING HEARING, commencing AUGUST 11, 2015, received and filed.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing.  Court in trial.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 2, 3, 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
filed.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Case calendared for Projected guilty plea hearing.  Defense counsel requests new date.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-23-2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION (HOC) FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction (HOC) for purposes of this hearing.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing. Defendant is still being considered for Drug Treatment Court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr in custody.  Ron Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.    Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Subway at 3025 S. 60th Street; Burger King at 4651 S 27th Street; McDonalds at 830 E Potter all in the City of Milwaukee, WI or Co-Defendant Govanni Martinez

Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
